name: Regulatory & Compliance Updates
description: Surfaces impactful, externally driven regulatory changes, enforcement actions, and compliance obligations that materially affect product, governance, risk, and legal teams.
positive_samples: The EU Commission just adopted new GDPR cross-border data transfer requirements effective March 2025.
New CCPA/CPRA amendments require explicit opt-out buttons for behavioral advertising by year-end.
The FTC announced new rules prohibiting dark patterns related to subscription sign-ups and cancellations.
SEC releases updated cybersecurity disclosure requirements for public companies, mandatory next quarter.
The CMA opened a formal investigation into platform algorithmic transparency obligations.
OFTC enforcement action: €32M fine issued to a SaaS provider for improper biometric data handling.
New export controls imposed on advanced AI chips and model weights exceeding specific performance thresholds.
The UK ICO issued updated guidance on children's data processing for online services.
A landmark ruling determined that vendors may be directly liable for negligent AI model deployment.
NIST just published the new AI Risk Management Framework 1.1 with mandatory adoption dates for federal vendors.
Updated PCI-DSS 4.0 requirements mandate multi-factor authentication for all administrative accounts.
The Digital Markets Act (DMA) has expanded its gatekeeper obligations with new interoperability mandates.
The EU AI Act final text requires conformity assessments for high-risk AI systems starting in 2026.
The FCC announced new privacy rules for telecom providers handling location data.
A new FINRA rule requires more stringent audit trails for automated trading algorithms.
France's CNIL published enforcement guidance for LLM-based products offering user profiling.
New HIPAA Security Rule updates require revisions to audit logging and data retention policies.
The German federal court issued a precedent limiting automated decision-making for employment screening tools.
An updated sanctions list affects cloud service exports to specific restricted jurisdictions.
The White House issued an executive order on AI safety requiring transparency reports from model developers.
OSHA introduced new reporting obligations for workplace sensors and monitoring technologies.
New EU ePrivacy revamp includes mandatory cookie-less consent flows for targeted advertising.
Singapore PDPC announced new penalties for cross-border data transfers without safeguards.
Brazil’s ANPD released new requirements for consent revocation workflows.
The CFPB issued policy guidance on the use of alternative data and AI in lending models.
A newly issued federal mandate requires certification for AI-generated financial advice systems.
The European Banking Authority introduced updated operational risk guidelines for cloud outsourcing.
APRA published requirements for third-party risk management for regulated financial institutions.
California passed new IoT security rules requiring unique device credentials at manufacture.
A new export regulation limits distribution of encryption technology above specific thresholds.
The EU passed new whistleblower protection obligations affecting internal reporting channels.
DOJ enforcement update: civil penalties for non-compliance with algorithmic fairness rules increased sharply.
New mandatory breach notification timelines introduced for critical infrastructure providers.
FERC announced new compliance standards for grid cyber vulnerability reporting.
A Supreme Court ruling redefines software copyright exceptions for AI-generated code.
Canada’s new privacy law (CPPA) introduces user data mobility and transparency obligations.
New guidance restricts automated surveillance tools in educational technology products.
The EDPB issued new interpretations of ‘legitimate interest’ affecting analytics providers.
State-level biometric privacy law now mandates explicit consent for facial recognition APIs.
The BIS introduced new export licensing requirements for AI training clusters.
New DOJ antitrust guidance affects API access restrictions for developer ecosystems.
Updated AML/KYC compliance frameworks for digital wallets become effective July 2025.
A new federal procurement rule mandates accessibility certifications for SaaS vendors.
Hong Kong’s PCPD published new penalties for inadequate breach response timelines.
Japan’s APPI introduces restrictions on cross-context behavioral tracking.
The EECC added new consumer protection rules impacting telecom product features.
European Court of Justice ruling requires transparency for automated credit scoring systems.
New mandatory model documentation requirements issued for AI-driven healthcare tools.
